attributes.action: amalgamate the Air Training Corps and the Combined Cadet Force's Royal Air Force Sections into one single organisation.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Merging the ATC and the CCF(RAF) will create one large organisation for Air Cadets. 

The current Air Cadet Organisation (ACO) is not an amalgamation, but rather a cooperative agency. The structures, uniforms and funding of both the ATC and the CCF(RAF) vary immensely and need to be brought under a single command and organisation.

As the ATC was established by a Royal Warrant in 1941 the new organisation should have "Royal" as its prefix and a name "Royal Air Force Cadets" or similar.
